com.ibm.team.process.common.advice
Class AdvisableOperation

java.lang.Object
  com.ibm.team.process.common.advice.AdvisableOperation
Direct Known Subclasses:
ProjectOperation
public abstract class AdvisableOperation
extends java.lang.Object

An operation advisable by process. Advisable operations can be configured by end users with pre-condition checks (@see IOperationAdvisor) and post-operation participation (@see IOperationParticipant).

Advisable operations must be declared via extension so that clients can view the list of available operations to configure when authoring their process. Advisable operations are declared on the client as elements of the extension point com.ibm.team.process.client.configurationPoints. Operations are declared on the server as elements of the extension point com.ibm.team.process.service.configurationPoints.

For example: 

     <extension
         point="com.ibm.team.process.client.configurationPoints">
         <operation
             id="com.ibm.example.operation"
             name="Example Operation">
                 <action id="foo">
                     <action id="bar"/>
                 </action>
                 <action id="foo2">
                     <action id="bar2"/>
                 </action>
         </operation>
     </extension>

Advisable operations may not be executed by clients directly. They should instead be passed to the advise and execute methods on the client or server process (@see com.ibm.team.process.client.IClientProcess and com.ibm.team.process.service.IServerProcess).

Since:
0.5

Constructor Detail

AdvisableOperation

public AdvisableOperation(java.lang.String operationId,
                          java.lang.Object operationData,
                          IProcessArea processArea)
Creates a new operation with the given identifier, which must be a valid operation identifier declared via the configurationPoints extension-point (see class comment for details). The given operation data is operation-specific data which will be made available to any advisors and participants which are configured for this operation.

The given process area determines the process which will govern this operation.

Parameters:
operationId - the operation identifier
operationData - the operation data or null
processArea - the affected process area

AdvisableOperation

public AdvisableOperation(java.lang.String operationId,
                          java.lang.Object operationData,
                          IProcessArea processArea,
                          IDevelopmentLine line)
Creates a new operation with the given identifier, which must be a valid operation identifier declared via the configurationPoints extension-point (see class comment for details). The given operation data is operation-specific data which will be made available to any advisors and participants which are configured for this operation.

Taken together, the given process area and development line determine the process which will govern this operation.

Parameters:
operationId - the operation identifier
operationData - the operation data or null
processArea - the affected process area
line - the affected development line or null
Method Detail

run

public abstract IOperationReport run(IBehaviorConfiguration configuration,
                                     org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                              throws TeamRepositoryException
Runs the operation and returns any advice which was computed in the course of executing the operation or null if no additional advice was computed. Typically, this is used to return advice which is run as part of the server-side implementation of a client-side operation.

Implementors of this method should check the progress monitor for cancellation when it is safe and appropriate to do so.

This method should not be called directly by clients. Clients wishing to run an operation should do so by via the methods on the client or server process.

Parameters:
configuration - the configuration which configures this operation or null
monitor - the monitor used to report progress and receive cancellation requests
Returns:
an operation report containing any advice which was computed in the course of running the operation or null
Throws:
TeamOperationCanceledException - in the event that this method caused another operation to run and that operation was canceled by process
StaleConfigurationDataException - if stale configuration data was used to advise the operation
TeamRepositoryException - if an error occurs

canReRun

public boolean canReRun()
Returns whether or not this operation can be rerun. Clients which override this method to return true should also override reRun(IBehaviorConfiguration, IProgressMonitor).

Returns:
whether this operation can be re-run

reRun

public IOperationReport reRun(IBehaviorConfiguration configuration,
                              org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                       throws TeamRepositoryException
Re-runs the operation and returns any advice which was computed in the course of executing the operation or null if no additional advice was computed. Typically, this is used to return advice which is run as part of the server-side implementation of an operation.

This method should not be called directly by clients. Clients wishing to re-run an operation should do so via IClientProcess#reAdviseAndExecute(AdvisableOperation).

Parameters:
configuration - the configuration which configures this operation or null
monitor - the monitor used to report progress and receive cancellation requests
Returns:
an operation report containing any advice which was computed in the course of running the operation or null
Throws:
TeamOperationCanceledException - in the event that this method caused another operation to run and that operation was canceled by process
StaleConfigurationDataException - if stale configuration data was used to advise the operation
TeamRepositoryException - if an error occurs

advise

public IOperationReport advise(IBehaviorConfiguration configuration,
                               org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                        throws TeamRepositoryException
Runs the given operation in "advise" mode. This method can optionally be overridden by clients who wish to provide additional hard-coded behavior when an operation is advised. For example, a client-side operation may call component API which does pre-condition checking.

This method should not be called directly by clients. Clients wishing to advise an operation should do so via IClientProcess#advise(AdvisableOperation).

Parameters:
configuration - the configuration which configures this operation or null
monitor - the monitor used to report progress and receive cancellation requests
Returns:
an operation report containing any advice which was computed in the course of running the operation or null
Throws:
StaleConfigurationDataException - if stale configuration data was used to advise the operation
TeamRepositoryException - if an error occurs

getActions

public java.lang.String[] getActions()
                              throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns the set of permission-requiring actions which this operation will perform when run which require permissions. If the current logged in user does not have permission to perform any of the returned action, process will reject any attempts to execute this operation.

Subclasses should override this method to enable process permissions for their operations. The returned actions are valid paths declared in the operation's extension. For example, if the operation extension declares the actions: 

  <action id="modify">
    <action id="fieldA"/>
    <action id="fieldB"/>
  </action>
The following would be valid element values in the returned array:
  • "modify"
  • "modify/fieldA"
  • "modify/fieldB"

Returns:
the set of permission-requiring actions which this operation will perform when run
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException - if an error occurs

getProcessArea

public IProcessArea getProcessArea()
Returns the process area associated with this operation. This area, along with the development line, determines what process applies to the operation.

Returns:
the process area associated with this operation

getSecondaryProcessAreas

public IProcessArea[] getSecondaryProcessAreas()
Returns a collection of process areas which are secondarily affected by this operation. The operation may specify actions which are performed relative to these areas and this operation will require permission to perform those actions in order to be executed.

This is important, for example, for an operation which moves an item from the context of one process area to another. In order to enforce a notion of ownership which is enforced by process permissions, such an action would specify the source area as a secondary process area and return an appropriate action such as "remove".

Secondary areas are consulted only for permissions. Advisors and participants configured for secondary areas are not invoked.

Secondary areas and their actions do not replace the primary area and its actions, returned from getProcessArea() and getActions().

Returns:
a collection of process areas which are secondarily affected by this operation

getSecondaryActions

public java.lang.String[] getSecondaryActions(IProcessArea secondaryArea)
                                       throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns the actions that this operation is performing relative to the given secondary area.

Parameters:
secondaryArea - the area
Returns:
the actions that this operation is performing relative to the given secondary area
Throws:
TeamRepositoryException - if an error occurs
See Also:
for more details

getSecondaryDevelopmentLine

public IDevelopmentLine getSecondaryDevelopmentLine(IProcessArea secondaryArea)
Returns the development line relative to which the given secondary area's actions will be performed or null if the given area is a team area. If the given area is a team area and this method returns null, the team area's development line will be automatically computed.

Subclasses which return only team areas as secondary process areas need not override this method.

This method must only be overridden by operations which potentially return project areas from AdvisableOperation.getSecondaryProcessAreas().

Parameters:
secondaryArea - the area
Returns:
the development line relative to which the given secondary area's actions will be performed

getDevelopmentLine

public IDevelopmentLine getDevelopmentLine()
Returns the development line associated with this operation or null if this operation's process area is a team area and the operation is using the team area's dev line.

Returns:
the development line associated with this operation or null

getOperationData

public java.lang.Object getOperationData()
Returns the operation-specific data associated with this operation or null if this operation carries no domain-specific data.

Returns:
the operation-specific data associated with this operation or null

getOperationIdentifier

public java.lang.String getOperationIdentifier()
Returns this operation's unique identifier.

Returns:
the unique identifier of the operation

shouldThrowPermissionDeniedException

public boolean shouldThrowPermissionDeniedException()
Returns whether the process framework should throw a PermissionDeniedException if the user does not have the permissions necessary to execute this operation. By default, the framework throws a TeamOperationCanceledException.

This is experimental support for components who wish to explore an alternate programming model.

Returns:
whether the process framework should potentially throw a PermissionDeniedException when asked to execute this operation

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
By default, advisable operations are considered equal if their operation data are equal. Implementers are encouraged to provide meaningful equality for their operation data or to override this method.

A meaningful equality check allows the framework to clear old operation reports when a new report is created for the same operation. For example, if the user attempts to save an item and is blocked by process, the next time they try to save the same item this should be identified as the same operation (allowing the framework to remove the previous report).

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
See Also:
Object.equals(java.lang.Object)

hashCode

public int hashCode()
Overrides:
hashCode in class java.lang.Object

getOperationConfigurationInfo

public IOperationConfigurationInfo getOperationConfigurationInfo()
Returns the operation configuration info for this operation or null if the info has not yet been set. The operation configuration info will be set by the process framework before the run, reRun, or advise methods are invoked. Extenders may rely on this method returning non-null inside their implementations of the run, rerun, and advise methods.

Components can use this info to validate that client-side process data is up to date by passing the info returned from a client-side operation to the server and then invoking IServerProcess#validateSource(...).

Clients may not override this method.

Returns:
the operation configuration info for this operation or null

setOperationConfigurationInfo

public void setOperationConfigurationInfo(IOperationConfigurationInfo info)
This method is called by the process framework before the run method is invoke.

Clients may not call this method.

Clients may not override this method.

setDevelopmentLine

public void setDevelopmentLine(IDevelopmentLine line)
This method is called by the process framework when a development line is dynamically computed for an operation.

Clients may not call this method.

Clients may not override this method.

setReportData

public void setReportData(java.lang.String[] reportData)
Sets this operation's report data or null if none.

When this operation is passed to the client or server process, the given report data will be set on the IOperationReport that is generated for the operation. Because this data is an operation-specific string which will be transmitted with the report even over the wire, this field is useful for implementors who wish to encode server-side data for a UI presentation.

getReportData

public java.lang.String[] getReportData()
Returns this operation's report data or null if none. This method is called by the process framework when creating a report for this operation. Clients generally need not call this method.

Returns:
the report data associated with this operation or null
